GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

I am happy with this and it is definitely better than the current situation. I know that people disagree on what default fields should eventually look like, though.

maintainer merge

I am happy with this and it is definitely better than the current situation. I know that people disagree on what default fields should eventually look like, though.

maintainer merge
This was not needed when we had default values, right?

Correct: but writing things this way is maybe a good thing to teach anyway, as otherwise you don't have anywhere to put your `rfl` lemmas saying what the operation does. This approach also resulted in quite a large performance boost in #6262 over trying to inline everything.

Can you modify the `exact_with_diamond_warning` so that if no instance for the required class is found, it will use the value of the field with the corresponding name?.

I think the behavior after this PR is still really bad for new users (and for teaching new users). It's hardly better than the status quo, and much worse than

I don't even know why #6262 is done. The PR description lists one reason, which seems incredibly weak to me.

> The motivation here is to make it more obvious when module diamonds are being introduced, or at least where they might be hiding; you can now simply search for nsmulRec in the source code.

I agree that when constructing new groups from old ones, you should not use the default value, and I'm happy to have a linter for that in Mathlib, but not at the cost of being unable to define what a group is with beginners without explaining what `nsmulRec` is and why we even need `nsmul` as a field.

Feel free to respond to these questions on Zulip, I believe no discussion about this happened before #6262 was merged.
Do you know why these errors happen? Do they happen when writing `nsmul := by exact nsmulRec`? Are you giving the expected type to the `exact` tactic?

I believe these errors happen because `foo := bar` defaults have special elaboration behavior that change the order in which the constructor arguments are elaborated, while `foo := by exact bar` does the more standard "meta variable populated by tactic" thing.
I don't think this is really helpful for beginners. Of course they are not sure that something they don't understand is not an issue.
I guess this could be toned down; really the point is to make `nsmul := nsmulRec` appear in source so that a reviewer can pick on it.
Do I really have to write this docstring twice?

```suggestion
  defValue := false
```
We can set it to `true` specifically for Mathlib.

pullRequest.title: feat: allow `nsmul` / `zsmul` to be omitted again, with a warning

nodes.body:
I am happy with this and it is definitely better than the current situation. I know that people disagree on what default fields should eventually look like, though.

maintainer merge
